rules.natural: If the production uses animal footage of a lion, then it completes an episode.
Provided that the production uses animal footage of an elephant, it completes an episode.
Whenever the production has camera equipment as material, it uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.
The production has camera equipment as material or it has editing software as material.

Either the production exceeds its budget, or if it is not the case that having editing software as material implies the use of animal footage of a lion or an elephant, then the production delays its release.
The production gets an award or it does not exceed its budget.
Should it not be true that having editing software as material leads to using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, then the production needs a reshoot.
If the absence of the implication that having editing software as material entails using animal footage of a lion or an elephant holds, then the production does not need a reshoot.
Given that it is not the case that the production having editing software as material necessitates using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, the production does not delay its release.

facts.natural: The production does not get an award.

steps.natural: In the event that the production has editing software as material, it uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.
Either the production uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.
It is not the case that the production exceeds its budget.
Assuming that it is false that the production having editing software as material results in using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, the production delays its release.
In the event that the production has editing software as material, it uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.
Either the production uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.

natural_facts.A1: The production uses animal footage of a lion.
natural_facts.A2: The production uses animal footage of an elephant.
natural_facts.A3: The production has camera equipment as material.
natural_facts.A4: The production has editing software as material.

natural_expressions: If the production uses animal footage of a lion, then it completes an episode.
Either the production uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.
Provided that the production uses animal footage of an elephant, it completes an episode.
Whenever the production has camera equipment as material, it uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.
The production has camera equipment as material or it has editing software as material.
In the event that the production has editing software as material, it uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.

Either the production exceeds its budget, or if it is not the case that having editing software as material implies the use of animal footage of a lion or an elephant, then the production delays its release.
The production gets an award or it does not exceed its budget.
Should it not be true that having editing software as material leads to using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, then the production needs a reshoot.
Assuming that it is false that the production having editing software as material results in using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, the production delays its release.
If the absence of the implication that having editing software as material entails using animal footage of a lion or an elephant holds, then the production does not need a reshoot.
Given that it is not the case that the production having editing software as material necessitates using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, the production does not delay its release.
It is not the case that the production exceeds its budget.
The production does not get an award.

(A1 → G).natural: If the production uses animal footage of a lion, then it completes an episode.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either the production uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.

(A2 → G).natural: Provided that the production uses animal footage of an elephant, it completes an episode.

(A3 → (A1 ∨ A2)).natural: Whenever the production has camera equipment as material, it uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: The production has camera equipment as material or it has editing software as material.

(A4 → (A1 ∨ A2)).natural: In the event that the production has editing software as material, it uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.

(A7 ∨ (¬(A4 → (A1 ∨ A2)) → A6)).natural: Either the production exceeds its budget, or if it is not the case that having editing software as material implies the use of animal footage of a lion or an elephant, then the production delays its release.

(A8 ∨ ¬A7).natural: The production gets an award or it does not exceed its budget.

(¬(A4 → (A1 ∨ A2)) → A5).natural: Should it not be true that having editing software as material leads to using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, then the production needs a reshoot.

(¬(A4 → (A1 ∨ A2)) → A6).natural: Assuming that it is false that the production having editing software as material results in using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, the production delays its release.

(¬(A4 → (A1 ∨ A2)) → ¬A5).natural: If the absence of the implication that having editing software as material entails using animal footage of a lion or an elephant holds, then the production does not need a reshoot.

(¬(A4 → (A1 ∨ A2)) → ¬A6).natural: Given that it is not the case that the production having editing software as material necessitates using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, the production does not delay its release.

¬A7.natural: It is not the case that the production exceeds its budget.

¬A8.natural: The production does not get an award.
